text: The Producers Guild of America Award for Outstanding Producer of Live Entertainment & Talk Television is an annual award given by the Producers Guild of America since 2005. The award has gone through several category classifications since its inception. At its start, the award was called the Television Producer of the Year Award in Variety Television, before transitioning to Outstanding Producer of Live Entertainment & Competition Television in 2008, until its current title was introduced in 2012. ==Winners and nominations== ===2000s=== Outstanding Producer of Variety Television {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%" |- bgcolor="#bebebe" ! width="5%" | Year ! width="25%" | Program ! width="65%" | Producers ! width="5%" | Network |- | rowspan=6 style="text-align:center" | 2004 (16th) |- style="background:#FAEB86" | The Ellen DeGeneres Show | Ellen DeGeneres, Mary Connelly, Ed Glavin, Andy Lassner, Karen Kilgariff | Syndication |- | Chappelle's Show | Dave Chappelle, Neal Brennan, Michele Armour | Comedy Central |- | Late Show with David Letterman | Maria Pope, Barbara Gaines, Rob Burnett, Jude Brennan | CBS |- | Saturday Night Live | Lorne Michaels, Steve Higgins, Marci Klein, Michael Shoemaker, Ken Aymong | NBC |- | The 76th Annual Academy Awards | Joe Roth, Michael B.
